result.execSummary:
The defendant Dirk L Ormsby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with any Meier Store located in Washington Co, WI.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and shall complete any recommended treatment.  

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dirk L Ormsby

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dirk L Ormsby in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Dirk L Ormsby.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. Def has paid up-front restitution.  State moves to amend charge to Misd Retail Theft, 943.50(1m)(d)&(4)(a); Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Statements from State,  counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dirk L Ormsby not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Dirk L Ormsby.  Counsel has just been informed that defendant is in Kenosha County Jail, anticipated waiving prelim and proceeding to resolution; Statements from State; Joint request to have matter set for anticipated plea and sentencing. Attorney Kippa believes that defendant will be agreeable to appearing by video, however is hopeful that will be out of custody.  Court directs that defendant to appear in person, Attorney Kippa shall notify the Court in the event defendant is still in custody so that arrangements can be made for the defendant to appear by video. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and anticipated resolution.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

At the request of counsel the hearing on 7/13/22 has been removed, per the direction of the Court a preliminary hearing has been scheduled for 8/18/22 at 11:00, parties notified and notice of hearing sent.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dirk L Ormsby in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Dirk L Ormsby. Counsel's first appearance. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

No contact with Washington County Meijer stores

Clerk BMC; Apprs: Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dirk L Ormsby appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran appeared by video for Dirk L Ormsby. Def consents to appearing by video. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Def advises he will be retaining his own private counsel. Court sets $1000.00 signature bond. Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing. Court accepts. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
